title: 107_hr3920
content: The "Rancher Preservation Act" is the short title of the Act. Section 13 of the Endangered Species Act of 1973 is amended to include special requirements regarding the black-tailed prairie dog. Section 13 of the Endangered Species Act of 1973 is amended to include requirements for using the best scientific and commercial data available when determining the status of the black-tailed prairie dog. This includes giving greater weight to empirical or peer-reviewed data and field observations, as well as data on population numbers. The Secretary must not classify the species as endangered or threatened without field data and must acknowledge data from landowners. The amended Section 13 of the Endangered Species Act requires the acknowledgment and inclusion of data collected by landowners on the status of the black-tailed prairie dog in the rulemaking record for determining its endangered or threatened status. Independent scientific review requirements define actions related to the species and qualified individuals involved. The term 'qualified individual' in the Endangered Species Act refers to someone with scientific expertise in the biological sciences, specifically related to the black-tailed prairie dog or similar species. They must demonstrate expertise through peer-reviewed publications, have no conflicts of interest, not be involved in any petitions or determinations, and have no financial ties. The Secretary appoints independent scientific reviewers from a list developed with recommendations from the National Academy of Sciences. Three qualified individuals review and report on the scientific information before any action becomes final. The reviewers must have no conflicts of interest and their activities are not subject to scrutiny. The Secretary appoints independent scientific reviewers from a list developed with recommendations from the National Academy of Sciences. Reviewers are compensated for their work and must provide their opinion on relevant scientific information within 3 months. The Secretary evaluates the reviewers' recommendations and includes a summary of the independent scientific review in the final determination. The independent scientific reviewers' report, including results and explanations for not following recommendations, must be publicly available for review before the comment period ends on the proposed action. A conforming amendment is made to the table of sections in the Act. Special requirements regarding black-tailed prairie dog are outlined in Sec. 13.
